thread.title: Football: Friday picks for Week 8 - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Football: Friday picks for Week 8 - PrepXtra Story

author: knoxnews.com
title: Football: Friday picks for Week 8 - PrepXtra
text:
West (5-1) at Farragut (6-0): Sixth-ranked West has quietly remained in the Class 5A media poll, despite a handful of marquee injuries, and Farragut has surged to No. 3, thanks to its first 6-0 start since 2008. The Admirals are talented on both lines of scrimmage, but their knack for rushing the passer, particularly with ends Cole Strange and Ben Hoffman, will be the difference on Friday. The Rebels scrambled to add depth in their backfield after sophomore running back Devante Patrick tore the ACL in his right knee against Powell in Week 5 and still are looking for complementary big-play threats alongside wide receiver Jermaine “Boom” Buchannon. Farragut is averaging 38.3 points per game this season.
PrepXtra Pick: Farragut 31, West 24
Greenback (4-2, 2-0 Region 2-1A) at Coalfield (6-1, 2-1): Ninth-ranked Greenback has beaten No. 8 Coalfield in the past two regular seasons, only to fall to the Yellow Jackets in the playoffs. The Cherokees boast a pair of capable running backs in Kayne Roberts and Devin Devine, and quarterback Hunter Willis is a viable option in the passing game. Coalfield, which has surrendered more than 20 points twice this season, should match up well defensively. Jordan Ervin has led the Yellow Jackets to two wins after stepping in at quarterback for Parker McKinney (collarbone), but last week’s slow start played a role in a 21-16 loss to Harriman. Keep an eye on Greenback defensive lineman Josh Silvey, the reigning KIL Sophomore of the Year who transferred from Catholic during the offseason.
PrepXtra Pick: Greenback 21, Coalfield 16
Battle Ground Academy (5-1) at Webb (3-3), 7 p.m., 10News2: This is a rematch of last season’s Division II-A state championship game, which Webb won 38-21. Both teams are coming off tough losses. The Spartans’ run-game fizzled in a 20-14 loss to Donelson Christian Academy last week, and BGA was limited to a season-low seven points against Davidson Academy. Webb will have to fix inconsistencies in the ground game in a hurry to nix the impact of BGA quarterback Clay Beathard, the brother of Iowa starting QB C.J. Beathard.
PrepXtra Pick: BGA 25, Webb 16
Hardin Valley (3-3, 1-2 Region 1-6A) at Jefferson County (3-3, 1-2): The tough losses have been aplenty for Hardin Valley in Region 1-6A this season. The Hawks suffered a gut-wrenching, two-point defeat to Dobyns-Bennett, and couldn’t muster enough red-zone offense to avoid a 20-7 loss to Science Hill. Still, HVA is in position to host a first-round playoff game if it can secure wins against Jefferson County, Bradley Central and William Blount during the next three weeks. The Hawks have relied on a steady running game, led by Issiah Aguero and Tim Frizzell, to complement one of the better defenses in the area. Jefferson County has the personnel to test the latter. Patriots quarterback Austin Jenkins accounted for five touchdowns last week against William Blount, throwing four TD passes.
PrepXtra Pick: Hardin Valley 24, Jefferson County 14
